posts.text:
Sælir Vaktarar,
Datt í hug að deila með ýkkur smá project sem ég var að byrja á.
ég mun deila þessu á ensku þar sem ég er einnig að deila þetta á fjölda erlendum forums og til að spara mér tímann þá er eitt túngumál ýfir allt.
Þetta project er gert í nýjum bequiet! Darkbase 700 sem að mínu mati er hríkalega vel hannaður kassi með fullt af góðum fítusum,
en er ekki alveg "Flawless"
ýkkur er velkomið að skíla eftir skoðun og comment 
Njótið!!
@JHPCmods
https://www.facebook.com/JHPCmods/
WORK IN PROGRESS...
Specs:
System Board:ASRock X370 Professional Gaming
CPU: Ryzen 1700X @4GHz
RAM: 16Gb DDR4 Trident Z @ 3033 mhz
GPU:Asus Strix 1080 
PSU: bequiet! 600Watts SFX-L 
HDD: 1Tb Western Digital Black 2.5"
SSD: 256 Samsung evo 2.5"
NVME: 256Gb Samsung 960Pro 
NVME:256Gb Samsung 951 
Case: bequiet! Dark Base 700
Cooling: 
Fans: bequiet! Silent Wings 3
Radiators:EK 360PE  - 280mm- EK140mm
Reservoir: 150ml - Alphacoool
Pump: Aquacomputer aquastream xt ultra
Fittings:Bitspower - Barrow - 
Tubing:Barrow Chrome - acrylic 
Gpu :Ek FC1080
Cpu: Aquacomputer  Cuplex Kryos NEXT 
NVME: Aquacomputer KryoM.2
Plans:
Custom psu cover,removing the existing plastic panels and create my own that can handle some passthrougs for watercooling)
thinking of custom painting some parts down the road (white )
custom cable housing to make the back look clean without door.
Custom cover for my NVME waterblock.

To make best use of the bottom compartment to house more watrercooling and to keep the top clean,
i have to cut down on other things instead,
since a powersupply usually takes the most space under there lets start there,
with the new line from bequiet! the SFX-L 600watts,
i was able to cut down a large ammountof the clutter underneath the psu shroud.
This powersupply is really special ,it looks like a sfx powersupply but with ATX features,like a 120mm fan,
or the extra gpu power for a sli setup .
Compared to the Silverstone SFX psu .

Really liking the top radiator mounting solution they integrated in this beast of a case,
so much versatility.
although i was not able to fit a 360 slim radiator oin the top and on the front at the same time,
so i will have to go with a 280mm in the front and a 350mm on top .
Took a closer look at the frontpanel assembly which houses a new sort of led lighting conzept,
really like how they did it (what is you´re opinion)
Also like the touch of the cablemanagement hook on top of the rear IO for the rear fan cable to route it over and keep it in place  
 
And also took a quick glans at the silent wings 3 Fans really good looking and powerfull fans,and not to forget to mention SILENT!
Starting on the cover for the HDD bays,to be able to screw in some pssthroughs to route some of the watercooling through the back,

also started on the top plate for the psu shroud which will have some ventialtion cutouts over the powersupply,
and house some passthroughs for fittings aswell,
might also be installing a temp display into that cover later one (we´ll see)
er að fíla þennan kassa ,verður gaman að sjá hvað þú getur gert með þessum.

Já þessi kassi er hríkalega flottur,
Reyni að gera eitthvað flott úr þessu.
(fingerscrossed)

getting some work done on tje case.
the midplate is finished for now.
the plate falls smoothly into the groove of tje case with that 45 degree angle.
passthrough holes for watercooling loop and filling are done.
also finished the drive bay cover with 10 passthrough holes 
for some passthrough tubing madness.

Getting soþe test loop done with some scrap tubing.
jist to get a feel for what os possible.
really liking the space in the back :-)
What do you think.

Getting some work done on the be quiet ! dark base 700.
had to make some drastic changes to the loop since the flowrate was quite terrible(it would have worked but the pump would't have lived long.
Lots of acrylic sanding before gluing pieces together and the paint.

This project is getting along slowly but surely,
panels sanded ,primed and painted ,
tryed some differen t paintstyles and thought to go a little wild and free on this one,
light green with white "twotonewar".
i think it came out nicely,
now i am waiting on some more bolts and anodized washers to arrive.
then i should be able to finish this build soon.
Thank you for checking out my buildlog,
